verses.verse: Now these<WH428> are the judgments<WH4941> which<WH834> thou shalt set<WH7760> before<WH6440> them.
If <WH3588> thou buy<WH7069> a Hebrew<WH5680> servant,<WH5650> six<WH8337> years<WH8141> he shall serve:<WH5647> and in the seventh<WH7637> he shall go out<WH3318> free<WH2670> for nothing.<WH2600>

If <WH518> he came in<WH935> by himself,<WH1610> he shall go out<WH3318> by himself:<WH1610> if<WH518> he<WH1931> were married,<WH1167> <WH802> then his wife<WH802> shall go out<WH3318> with<WH5973> him.

If <WH518> his master<WH113> have given<WH5414> him a wife,<WH802> and she have born<WH3205> him sons<WH1121> or<WH176> daughters;<WH1323> the wife<WH802> and her children<WH3206> shall be<WH1961> her master's,<WH113> and he<WH1931> shall go out<WH3318> by himself.<WH1610>

And if<WH518> the servant<WH5650> shall plainly say,<WH559> <WH559> I love<WH157> <WH853> my master,<WH113> <WH853> my wife,<WH802> and my children;<WH1121> I will not<WH3808> go out<WH3318> free: <WH2670>

Then his master<WH113> shall bring<WH5066> him unto<WH413> the judges;<WH430> he shall also bring<WH5066> him to<WH413> the door,<WH1817> or<WH176> unto<WH413> the door post;<WH4201> and his master<WH113> shall bore his ear through<WH7527> <WH853> <WH241> with an awl;<WH4836> and he shall serve<WH5647> him forever.<WH5769>
And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> sell<WH4376> <WH853> his daughter<WH1323> to be a maidservant,<WH519> she shall not<WH3808> go out<WH3318> as the menservants<WH5650> do.<WH3318>

If <WH518> she please not<WH7451> <WH5869> her master,<WH113> who<WH834> hath betrothed<WH3808> <WH3259> her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed:<WH6299> to sell<WH4376> her unto a strange<WH5237> nation<WH5971> he shall have no<WH3808> power,<WH4910> seeing he hath dealt deceitfully<WH898> with her.
And if<WH518> he have betrothed<WH3259> her unto his son,<WH1121> he shall deal<WH6213> with her after the manner<WH4941> of daughters.<WH1323>
If <WH518> he take<WH3947> him another<WH312> wife; her food,<WH7607> her raiment,<WH3682> and her duty of marriage,<WH5772> shall he not<WH3808> diminish.<WH1639>
And if<WH518> he do<WH6213> not<WH3808> these<WH428> three<WH7969> unto her, then shall she go out<WH3318> free<WH2600> without<WH369> money.<WH3701>
He that smiteth<WH5221> a man,<WH376> so that he die,<WH4191> shall be surely put to death.<WH4191> <WH4191>

And if<WH834> a man lie not in wait,<WH6658> <WH3808> but God<WH430> deliver<WH579> him into his hand;<WH3027> then I will appoint<WH7760> thee a place<WH4725> whither<WH834> <WH8033> he shall flee.<WH5127>

But if<WH3588> a man<WH376> come presumptuously<WH2102> upon<WH5921> his neighbor,<WH7453> to slay<WH2026> him with guile;<WH6195> thou shalt take<WH3947> him from<WH4480> <WH5973> mine altar,<WH4196> that he may die.<WH4191>
And he that smiteth<WH5221> his father,<WH1> or his mother,<WH517> shall be surely put to death.<WH4191> <WH4191>
And he that stealeth<WH1589> a man,<WH376> and selleth<WH4376> him, or if he be found<WH4672> in his hand,<WH3027> he shall surely be put to death.<WH4191> <WH4191>
And he that curseth<WH7043> his father,<WH1> or his mother,<WH517> shall surely be put to death.<WH4191> <WH4191>

And if<WH3588> men<WH376> strive together,<WH7378> and one<WH376> smite<WH5221> <WH853> another<WH7453> with a stone,<WH68> or<WH176> with his fist,<WH106> and he die<WH4191> not,<WH3808> but keepeth<WH5307> his bed: <WH4904>

If <WH518> he rise again,<WH6965> and walk<WH1980> abroad<WH2351> upon<WH5921> his staff,<WH4938> then shall he that smote<WH5221> him be quit:<WH5352> only<WH7535> he shall pay<WH5414> for the loss of his time,<WH7674> and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.<WH7495> <WH7495>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> <WH853> his servant,<WH5650> or<WH176> <WH853> his maid,<WH519> with a rod,<WH7626> and he die<WH4191> under<WH8478> his hand;<WH3027> he shall be surely punished.<WH5358> <WH5358>
Notwithstanding, <WH389> if<WH518> he continue<WH5975> a day<WH3117> or<WH176> two,<WH3117> he shall not<WH3808> be punished:<WH5358> for<WH3588> he<WH1931> is his money.<WH3701>

If <WH3588> men<WH376> strive,<WH5327> and hurt<WH5062> a woman<WH802> with child,<WH2030> so that her fruit<WH3206> depart<WH3318> from her, and yet no<WH3808> mischief<WH611> follow:<WH1961> he shall be surely punished,<WH6064> <WH6064> according as<WH834> the woman's<WH802> husband<WH1167> will lay<WH7896> upon<WH5921> him; and he shall pay<WH5414> as the judges<WH6414> determine.
And if<WH518> any mischief<WH611> follow,<WH1961> then thou shalt give<WH5414> life<WH5315> for<WH8478> life,<WH5315>
Eye <WH5869> for<WH8478> eye,<WH5869> tooth<WH8127> for<WH8478> tooth,<WH8127> hand<WH3027> for<WH8478> hand,<WH3027> foot<WH7272> for<WH8478> foot,<WH7272>
Burning <WH3555> for<WH8478> burning,<WH3555> wound<WH6482> for<WH8478> wound,<WH6482> stripe<WH2250> for<WH8478> stripe.<WH2250>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> <WH853> the eye<WH5869> of his servant,<WH5650> or<WH176> <WH853> the eye<WH5869> of his maid,<WH519> that it perish;<WH7843> he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his eye's sake.<WH8478> <WH5869>

And if<WH518> he smite out<WH5307> his manservant's<WH5650> tooth,<WH8127> or<WH176> his maidservant's<WH519> tooth;<WH8127> he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his tooth's sake.<WH8478> <WH8127>

If <WH3588> an ox<WH7794> gore<WH5055> <WH853> a man<WH376> or<WH176> <WH853> a woman,<WH802> that they die:<WH4191> then the ox<WH7794> shall be surely stoned,<WH5619> <WH5619> and<WH853> his flesh<WH1320> shall not<WH3808> be eaten;<WH398> but the owner<WH1167> of the ox<WH7794> shall be quit.<WH5355>

But if<WH518> the ox<WH7794> were wont to push with his horn<WH5056> in time past,<WH4480> <WH8543> <WH8032> and it hath been testified<WH5749> to his owner,<WH1167> and he hath not<WH3808> kept him in,<WH8104> but that he hath killed<WH4191> a man<WH376> or<WH176> a woman;<WH802> the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned,<WH5619> and his owner<WH1167> also<WH1571> shall be put to death.<WH4191>

If <WH518> there be laid<WH7896> on<WH5921> him a sum of money,<WH3724> then he shall give<WH5414> for the ransom<WH6306> of his life<WH5315> whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> is laid<WH7896> upon<WH5921> him.
Whether <WH176> he have gored<WH5055> a son,<WH1121> or<WH176> have gored<WH5055> a daughter,<WH1323> according to this<WH2088> judgment<WH4941> shall it be done<WH6213> unto him.

If <WH518> the ox<WH7794> shall push<WH5055> a manservant<WH5650> or<WH176> a maidservant;<WH519> he shall give<WH5414> unto their master<WH113> thirty<WH7970> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> and the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned.<WH5619>

And if<WH3588> a man<WH376> shall open<WH6605> a pit,<WH953> or<WH176> if<WH3588> a man<WH376> shall dig<WH3738> a pit,<WH953> and not<WH3808> cover<WH3680> it, and an ox<WH7794> or<WH176> an ass<WH2543> fall<WH5307> therein;<WH8033>
The owner<WH1167> of the pit<WH953> shall make it good,<WH7999> and give<WH7725> money<WH3701> unto the owner<WH1167> of them; and the dead<WH4191> beast shall be<WH1961> his.

And if<WH3588> one man's<WH376> ox<WH7794> hurt<WH5062> <WH853> another's,<WH7794> <WH7453> that he die;<WH4191> then they shall sell<WH4376> <WH853> the live<WH2416> ox,<WH7794> and divide<WH2673> <WH853> the money<WH3701> of it; and<WH853> the dead<WH4191> ox also<WH1571> they shall divide.<WH2673>

Or <WH176> if it be known<WH3045> that<WH3588> the ox<WH7794> hath used to push<WH5056> in time past,<WH4480> <WH8543> <WH8032> and his owner<WH1167> hath not<WH3808> kept him in;<WH8104> he shall surely pay<WH7999> <WH7999> ox<WH7794> for<WH8478> ox;<WH7794> and the dead<WH4191> shall be<WH1961> his own.
